questions.text: Which is the most common Osteoporotic fracture site? (INICET MAY 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Vertebral fracture

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The most common site for osteoporotic fractures is the vertebral column followed by femur (mainly neck) and lower end of the radius.
  • ➤ The most common site for osteoporotic fractures is the vertebral column followed by femur (mainly neck) and lower end of the radius.

questions.text: Which of the following is seen in physiological jaundice? ( INICET MAY 2021)

options.label: A
options.text: Increased indirect bilirubin, increased urobilinogen, absent bilirubin in urine

options.label: B
options.text: Increased indirect bilirubin, absent urobilinogen, absent bilirubin in urine

options.label: C
options.text: Increased direct bilirubin, increased urobilinogen, absent bilirubin in urine

options.label: D
options.text: Increased direct bilirubin, absent urobilinogen, absent bilirubin in urine

questions.correct_answer: A. Increased indirect bilirubin, increased urobilinogen, absent bilirubin in urine
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Increased indirect bilirubin, increased urobilinogen, absent bilirubin in urine

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Physiological jaundice is characterized by increased indirect bilirubin, increased urobilinogen, and the absence of bilirubin in the urine.

questions.text: Which organ is the earliest to undergo putrefaction from the given options? (NEET PG 2018)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Brain

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The order of organ putrefaction (early to late) is as follows:
  • ➤ Larynx and trachea Liver and lungs Brain Heart Kidney Prostate and Non Gravid uterus Skin, muscle, tendons Bones and teeth
  • ➤ Larynx and trachea
  • ➤ Liver and lungs
  • ➤ Brain
  • ➤ Heart
  • ➤ Kidney
  • ➤ Prostate and Non Gravid uterus
  • ➤ Skin, muscle, tendons
  • ➤ Bones and teeth
  • ➤ Prostate and Non gravid uterus are organs which putrefy very late. The gravid uterus putrefies earlier.
  • ➤ Mnemonic: LBHK
  • ➤ Mnemonic:
  • ➤ L for larynx, liver, lungs, B for brain H for Heart, K for Kidney

questions.text: An internist in India is seeing a patient from a minority cultural and linguistic group. To foster therapeutic alliance and provide the best care possible, which of the following approaches should the physician prioritize? (INICET MAY 2022) Insist on good communication. Insist on communication only via an interpreter. Treat them regardless of their cultural perceptions. Consider the patient's religion and cultural perception.
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) 1, 4

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The communication skills of physicians are an effective step of making effective relationship between doctor and patient Research has shown that the way patients perceive their connection with their physician significantly influences their sense of satisfaction and level of concern about their health The goal of culturally competent health care services is to provide the highest quality of care to every patient, regardless of race, ethnicity, cultural background
  • ➤ The communication skills of physicians are an effective step of making effective relationship between doctor and patient
  • ➤ Research has shown that the way patients perceive their connection with their physician significantly influences their sense of satisfaction and level of concern about their health
  • ➤ The goal of culturally competent health care services is to provide the highest quality of care to every patient, regardless of race, ethnicity, cultural background

questions.text: Which of the following are indications for surgical intervention in abdominal aortic aneurysms? (NEET PG 2024)

options.label: A
options.text: Size more than 5.5 cm in males

questions.explanation:
Ans. D. All of the above

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Abdominal aortic aneurysms require surgical intervention if the size exceeds 5.5 cm in males, the patient presents with abdominal pain, or if there is an expansion of more than 0.5 cm within 6 months.

questions.text: Foreign body entry into the laryngeal inlet is prevented by the cough reflex. This reflex is sluggish in alcohol ingestion and some other conditions. Which nerve is likely injured? (INICET MAY 2022)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Internal laryngeal nerve

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Damage to or inhibition of the internal laryngeal nerve can significantly impair the cough reflex by reducing the sensory input required to detect irritants above the vocal cords, emphasizing its pivotal role in this protective reflex.
  • ➤ Ref - Dhingra 7th edition, Page No. 337
  • ➤ Ref - Dhingra 7th edition, Page No. 337

questions.text: Which of the following is correct regarding the patient who presented with the following as shown in the image. Earlier the abdominal mass was reducible, but now it has become irreducible? (FMGE JULY 2024)

options.label: A
options.text: Mass as shown should be removed

options.label: B
options.text: Mass should be reduced by a surgical procedure and mesh repair should be done

options.label: C
options.text: Mass should be reduced and anatomical repair by suturing the abdominal wall defect should be done

options.label: D
options.text: Mass should be reduced, mesh repair done and the redundant skin should be excised

questions.correct_answer: D. Mass should be reduced, mesh repair done and the redundant skin should be excised
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Mass should be reduced, mesh repair done and the redundant skin should be excised

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ For an irreducible umbilical or para-umbilical hernia, the recommended treatment includes hernia reduction, mesh repair, and excision of redundant or unhealthy skin to ensure a durable and effective repair.

questions.text: Identify the investigation shown. (FMGE JULY 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) PET

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The investigation shown in the image is a PET scan (and PET-CT), which highlights areas of high metabolic activity, commonly used for detecting cancer.
  • ➤ PET scan

questions.text: A patient was suspected to have acute brucellosis. A serum sample was sent for a standard agglutination test. It came out to be negative initially but after serial dilutions of the serum sample, the test turned out to be positive. Which of the following is responsible for the initial negative test? (NEET PG 2021)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Prozone phenomenon

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective
  • ➤ The prozone phenomenon, responsible for initial false-negative results in serological tests like the standard agglutination test for brucellosis, occurs due to excessive antibodies preventing visible agglutination. This can be corrected by diluting the serum, which highlights the importance of considering antibody concentration in diagnostic testing.

questions.text: Which of the following component is absent in the smooth muscle? (FMGE JULY 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Troponin

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Troponin is absent in smooth muscle; instead, calcium binds to calmodulin to facilitate muscle contraction.

questions.text: Which can be used as an alternative to breast milk in low birth weight (LBW) child? (INICET MAY 2022)
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Human donor milk

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Human donor milk is the alternative to breast milk in low birth weight infants

questions.text: A 48 year old male smoker presented with cough and foul smelling sputum which increased on change in posture. He had similar episodes multiple times in last few years. Which of the following is the likely diagnosis? (FMGE JANUARY 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Bronchiectasis

Explanation:

  • • Explanation:
  • • The key features presented in this case are a 48-year-old male smoker with chronic cough, foul-smelling sputum, and an increase in sputum production upon changing posture. Additionally, the patient has experienced similar episodes multiple times over the past few years. These clinical manifestations strongly suggest a diagnosis of bronchiectasis.
  • • Bronchiectasis is a chronic condition characterized by permanent dilation and destruction of the bronchi (airways) due to recurrent inflammation or infection. It leads to impaired clearance of secretions, resulting in the accumulation of thick, foul-smelling sputum within the dilated airways. The sputum production often increases upon postural changes, as described in this case, due to the pooling of secretions within the dilated bronchial segments.
  • • Bronchiectasis is a chronic condition characterized by permanent dilation and destruction of the bronchi (airways) due to recurrent inflammation or infection.
  • • Other Options:
  • • Other Options:
  • • Option A. Asthma: While asthma can present with cough and wheezing, it is not typically associated with foul-smelling sputum or a significant change in sputum production upon postural changes.
  • • Option A. Asthma:
  • • Option B. Carcinoma of the lung: Lung cancer can cause cough and sputum production, but the sputum is usually not described as foul-smelling. Additionally, the recurrent nature of the episodes over several years is less consistent with lung cancer.
  • • Option B. Carcinoma of the lung:
  • • Option D. Lung abscess: A lung abscess can also present with cough and foul-smelling sputum, but it is typically an acute condition and is less likely to have recurrent episodes over several years without appropriate treatment.
  • • Option D. Lung abscess:

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In a patient with a history of chronic cough, foul-smelling sputum production that increases with postural changes, and recurrent episodes over several years, bronchiectasis should be strongly considered as the likely diagnosis, especially in the presence of risk factors such as smoking.

questions.text: ASEPSIS wound scoring takes all of the following into consideration except: (NEET PG 2020)
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Induration

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The ASEPSIS wound scoring system does not include induration as a criterion. It focuses on factors like purulent and serous discharge, erythema, separation of deep tissue, additional treatments, bacterial isolation, and extended hospital stay to evaluate surgical site infections.

questions.text: A 9-year-old boy comes with complaints of left ear pain, difficulty in opening the mouth, painful swallowing, and fever. The oral cavity examination reveals the following. The external facial examination is unremarkable. Which of the following is likely? (NEET PG 2020)
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Quinsy

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Quinsy is a severe infection requiring prompt recognition and treatment to prevent complications. It distinctly affects the peritonsillar area, leading to significant local and systemic symptoms that guide its diagnosis and management.
  • ➤ Ref - Dhingra 7 th edition, Page No. 299
  • ➤ Ref - Dhingra 7 th edition, Page No. 299

questions.text: A 70-year-old male patient presents with decreased hearing in higher frequencies. It was noted that the basilar membrane was affected. Which of the following structures lie near the affected structure? (NEET PG 2022)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Oval window

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In cases of high-frequency hearing loss, the basal turn of the cochlea near the oval window is typically involved. Understanding the anatomical proximity of the oval window to the basal turn helps in pinpointing the site of lesion and aids in specific diagnostic and therapeutic approaches aimed at the high-frequency hearing spectrum.

questions.text: A pregnant female who is a known case of bronchial asthma presented to hospital with blood pressure of 160/100 mm Hg. Which of the following is the preferred drug for this patient? (Fmge Jan 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Nifedipine

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Nifedipine, a calcium channel blocker is effective in lowering blood pressure and is generally considered safe in pregnancy. It does not have the bronchoconstrictive effects associated with beta-blockers.

questions.text: Which of the following is a direct cause of maternal death? (FMGE JULY 2023)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Pre-eclampsia

Explanation:

  • • Explanation:
  • • Maternal deaths can be classified into direct and indirect causes. Direct causes are those that result from complications of pregnancy, labor, or the postpartum period, whereas indirect causes are conditions that are exacerbated by pregnancy.
  • • Pre-eclampsia : This is a direct cause of maternal death. Pre-eclampsia is a hypertensive disorder of pregnancy that can lead to severe complications such as eclampsia, HELLP syndrome, stroke, and organ failure, all of which can directly result in maternal mortality.
  • • Pre-eclampsia
  • • Other Options:
  • • Other Options:
  • • Option A. Anemia : This is considered an indirect cause of maternal death. While severe anemia can exacerbate complications during pregnancy and childbirth, it is not a direct cause but increases the risk of infections, hemorrhage, and other complications.
  • • Option A. Anemia
  • • indirect cause
  • • Option B. Heart disease : This is also an indirect cause of maternal death. Pre-existing heart disease can worsen during pregnancy due to the increased cardiovascular demands, but it is not a complication arising directly from pregnancy.
  • • Option B. Heart disease
  • • indirect cause
  • • Option C. Embolism : Pulmonary embolism is considered an indirect cause of maternal death when it occurs due to pregnancy-related factors like deep vein thrombosis.
  • • Option C. Embolism

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Pre-eclampsia is a direct cause of maternal death, directly associated with complications arising from pregnancy, labor, or the postpartum period.

questions.text: A woman presents with a history of headaches for the past 9 months that worsen in a recumbent position and improve as the day progresses. She also gives a history of taking oral contraceptives. Fundal examination shows papilledema. There are no focal neurological deficits. What is the most probable cause of her headaches? (FMGE JAN 2023)
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Pseudotumor cerebri should be suspected in patients with chronic headaches that worsen when lying down, especially if they have papilledema and are on oral contraceptives.

questions.text: Local anesthesia used in cataract surgery is: (FMGE JULY 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Lignocaine 2%

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Lignocaine 2% is the standard local anesthetic used in cataract surgery due to its rapid onset and appropriate duration of action. However, it's important to note that topical anesthesia using proparacaine 0.5% is becoming increasingly common in modern cataract surgery techniques.
  • ➤ proparacaine 0.5% is becoming increasingly common in modern cataract surgery techniques.

questions.text: A patient presents to the casualty following blunt trauma to the chest. A chest X-ray was done. Among the following radiographs, in which case would you further evaluate the patient before putting a chest tube? (INICET MAY 2022)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) 3,4

Explanation:

  • • Explanation:
  • • Pneumothorax Hemothorax Consolidation Diaphragmatic hernia
  • • Pneumothorax
  • • Hemothorax
  • • Consolidation
  • • Diaphragmatic hernia
  • • Image 3: Consolidation would be managed symptomatically and chest tube shouldn’t be inserted.
  • • Image 3:
  • • Image 4: Diaphragmatic hernia: A direct blow to the diaphragm can cause it to rupture, allowing abdominal contents to herniate into the chest. In the case of stomach herniation into the chest, a nasogastric tube followed by chest radiography can be helpful. Video-assisted thoracoscopy or laparoscopy is the most accurate investigation.
  • • Image 4:
  • • Other Options:
  • • Other Options:
  • • Radiographs 1-2 show hemothorax and pneumothorax. Intercostal chest drains should be inserted into the fifth intercostal space. The safe landmark is a triangle anterior to the midaxillary line above the nipple, below, and lateral to the pectoralis major muscle.
  • • Radiographs 1-2

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In cases of blunt chest trauma, careful evaluation of chest radiographs is crucial. Consolidations (Image 3) and diaphragmatic hernias (Image 4) require specific management strategies distinct from those of pneumothorax or hemothorax, where immediate chest tube placement is standard.

questions.text: A couple already has 3 children and has been trying for another one for the last 1 year. However, the husband is diagnosed with hypogonadotropic hypogonadism. Which of the following is/are true? (INICET MAY 2022) Low FSH, low LH High FSH, low LH Oligospermia Low prolactin Low testosterone
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) 1, 3 and 5

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In hypogonadotropic hypogonadism, both FSH and LH levels are low, testosterone levels are low, and oligospermia is often present.
  • ➤ Ref: Page no 232, DC Dutta’s Textbook of Gynecology, 6 th edition
  • ➤ Ref: Page no 232, DC Dutta’s Textbook of Gynecology, 6 th edition

questions.text: In a case of RTA (Road Traffic Accident), a person has died. Who can order an autopsy? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Police Officer

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The Police Officer, specifically the Investigating Officer, has the authority to order an autopsy in cases of unexplained or suspicious deaths, such as those resulting from a road traffic accident.

questions.text: The false statement about fetal circulation is: (NEET PG 2020)

options.label: A
options.text: Anatomical closure of foramen ovale is by 3 to 5 days

options.label: B
options.text: Anatomical closure of ductus venosus is by 3 to 7 days

options.label: D
options.text: Anatomical closure of ductus arteriosus is by 2 to 3 weeks

questions.correct_answer: A. Anatomical closure of foramen ovale is by 3 to 5 days
questions.explanation:
Ans. A. Anatomical closure of foramen ovale is by 3 to 5 days

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The anatomical closure of the foramen ovale takes 1 month to a year.

questions.text: A 15-year-old boy presents to the Pediatrics OPD with the complaints of several episodes of melena. On physical examination, there was eczematous rash over the skin with multiple red pin-point hemorrhagic spots. His Hemogram reveals low platelet count and normal RBC and WBC counts. What is the next best investigation? (INICET MAY 2022)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) WASP gene mutation

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Wiskott-Aldrich Syndrome should be suspected in a pediatric patient with thrombocytopenia, eczema, and recurrent bleeding episodes, and the next best step is to investigate for a WASP gene mutation.
  • ➤ Ref: Robbins pathologic basis of disease 8th edition pg 439-440
  • ➤ Ref: Robbins pathologic basis of disease 8th edition pg 439-440

questions.text: Choose the most appropriate answer: (INICET NOV 2022) Assertion: In phenylketonuria, the urine has a mousy odor. Reason: The serum levels of tyrosine, dopamine, and norepinephrine are decreased in phenylketonuria.

options.label: A
options.text: Both assertion and reason are independently false statements.

options.label: B
options.text: The assertion is independently a true statement, but the reason is independently a false statement.

options.label: C
options.text: Both assertion and reason are independently true statements, but the reason is not the correct explanation for the assertion.

options.label: D
options.text: Both assertion and reason are independently true statements, and the reason is the correct explanation for the assertion.

questions.correct_answer: C. Both assertion and reason are independently true statements, but the reason is not the correct explanation for the assertion.
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Both assertion and reason are independently true statements, but the reason is not the correct explanation for the assertion.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In phenylketonuria, the mousy odor of urine is due to the accumulation of phenylacetate, while decreased levels of tyrosine and catecholamines are a result of the impaired conversion of phenylalanine to tyrosine. However, the two phenomena are not causally related.

questions.text: A 40-year-old female consumed a white colored rodenticide powder and presents with a potassium level of 2.5 mEq/L. She has irregular pulse and muscle paralysis. ECG shows multiple ventricular ectopic beats. What is the suspected poison? (INICET MAY 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Barium Carbonate

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Hypokalemia with symptoms such as muscle paralysis, irregular pulse, and ECG changes like ventricular ectopic beats strongly suggest poisoning with barium carbonate.

questions.text: What is the antihypertensive of choice in a 28-week preeclamptic woman with asthma? (FMGE JANUARY 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Nifedipine

Explanation:

  • • Explanation:
  • • In managing preeclampsia, labetalol is often the first-line antihypertensive due to its efficacy and safety profile in pregnancy. However, labetalol is both an alpha and beta-blocker, and its use can exacerbate asthma by causing bronchoconstriction. Therefore, it is contraindicated in asthmatic patients.
  • • Nifedipine: This is a calcium channel blocker that is safe and effective in pregnancy. It does not have the bronchoconstrictive effects of labetalol, making it the antihypertensive of choice for a preeclamptic woman with asthma.
  • • Other Options:
  • • Other Options:
  • • Option A. Oral labetalol and Option B. IV labetalol: Both forms are contraindicated in patients with asthma due to the risk of bronchoconstriction.
  • • Option A. Oral labetalol and Option B. IV labetalol:
  • • Option D. Telmisartan: This angiotensin receptor blocker (ARB) is contraindicated in pregnancy because it can cause fetal renal hypoperfusion and oligohydramnios, among other teratogenic effects.
  • • Option D. Telmisartan:

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Nifedipine is the antihypertensive of choice in a preeclamptic woman with asthma due to its safety profile and lack of broncho constrictive effects.

questions.text: What does phase III represent in the below image? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Alveolar plateau

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Phase III of the capnography waveform, also known as the alveolar plateau, represents the exhalation of alveolar gas and is used to determine the end-tidal CO2 level.

questions.text: After a severe penetrating head trauma, what is the risk of subsequent epilepsy? ( FMGE Jan 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) 45%

Explanation:

  • • Explanation:
  • • According to Harrison's Principles of Internal Medicine, the risk of developing subsequent epilepsy after severe penetrating head trauma is approximately 45%. This statistic highlights the significant risk associated with severe brain injuries, particularly those involving penetration, which can lead to long-term neurological complications such as epilepsy.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The risk of developing epilepsy after severe penetrating head trauma is approximately 45%.

questions.text: A 76-year-old man presented with generalized weakness, which increased towards the evening and improved with 5-10 minutes of rest in between. On examination, he also had ptosis and some difficulty in swallowing. What is the likely diagnosis? (NEET PG 2021)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B. Myasthenia Gravis

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Myasthenia Gravis is characterized by fluctuating muscle weakness that worsens with activity and improves with rest. Key clinical features include ptosis, difficulty swallowing, and generalized weakness with a diurnal variation.
  • ➤ Most sensitive diagnosis is supported by single fiber EMG and most specific investigation is antibody tests, such as acetylcholine receptor antibodies and anti-muscle specific kinase antibodies.

questions.text: Which of the following method is shown in the surgical procedure to close the abdominal wound with the help of a mesh? (FMGE JULY 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Onlay

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The onlay method involves placing the mesh on top of the abdominal muscles and rectus sheath, commonly used in open ventral hernia repairs.

questions.text: Which of the following is represented in the below figure by drug X? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Epsilon Amino Caproic acid

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Epsilon Amino Caproic Acid (EACA) is an anti-fibrinolytic drug that inhibits the activation of plasminogen, thereby preventing the breakdown of fibrin and stabilizing blood clots.

questions.text: Structure lies in the floor of inferior horn of lateral ventricle all except (INICET MAY 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Tail of caudate nucleus

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The tail of the caudate nucleus is located in the roof of the inferior horn of the lateral ventricle, not in the floor.

questions.text: Arrange in order the disaster management cycle.
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Impact → response → rehabilitation → mitigation

Explanation:

  • • Explanation:
  • • The correct chronological order of the disaster management cycle is as follows:
  • • 5 stages -
  • • 5 stages -
  • • Impact: This is the initial stage when a disaster strikes an area, such as an earthquake, flood, or tsunami. Response : In this stage, search and rescue operations, first aid, and medical relief efforts are launched. Rehabilitation : This stage focuses on addressing water, sanitation, food supply, vector control, and other essential services. Mitigation : Efforts are made to prevent hazards or risks from turning into disasters, minimizing potential damage. Preparedness: This stage involves planning and preparation for an anticipated disaster, such as a tsunami or earthquake season.
  • • Impact: This is the initial stage when a disaster strikes an area, such as an earthquake, flood, or tsunami.
  • • Impact:
  • • Response : In this stage, search and rescue operations, first aid, and medical relief efforts are launched.
  • • Response
  • • Rehabilitation : This stage focuses on addressing water, sanitation, food supply, vector control, and other essential services.
  • • Rehabilitation
  • • Mitigation : Efforts are made to prevent hazards or risks from turning into disasters, minimizing potential damage.
  • • Mitigation
  • • Preparedness: This stage involves planning and preparation for an anticipated disaster, such as a tsunami or earthquake season.
  • • Preparedness:
  • • The answer to this is choice A, which correctly arranges the stages as impact, response, rehabilitation, and mitigation.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The correct order of the disaster management cycle is impact, response, rehabilitation, mitigation, and preparedness, representing the chronological sequence of actions taken during and after a disaster.

questions.text: The maternal part of the placenta is called as? (FMGE JANUARY 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Decidua basalis

Explanation:

  • • Explanation:
  • • The decidua basalis is the specific part of the decidua (the endometrium of the pregnant uterus) that directly interacts with the chorion frondosum (the fetal part of the placenta) to form the maternal part of the placenta.
  • • Other Options:
  • • Other Options:
  • • Option A. Decidua parietalis: The remaining part of the decidua lining the uterine cavity that is not involved in the formation of the placenta.
  • • Option A. Decidua parietalis:
  • • Option B. Decidua capsularis: The part of the decidua that covers the embryo and the gestational sac, like a capsule.
  • • Option B. Decidua capsularis:
  • • Option D. Decidua spongiosum: This term is not typically used to describe parts of the decidua in the context of placentation.
  • • Option D. Decidua spongiosum:

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Decidua basalis: Forms the maternal part of the placenta. Decidua capsularis: Encloses the rest of the gestational sac. Decidua parietalis: Lines the remainder of the uterus.
  • ➤ Decidua basalis: Forms the maternal part of the placenta.
  • ➤ Decidua capsularis: Encloses the rest of the gestational sac.
  • ➤ Decidua parietalis: Lines the remainder of the uterus.

questions.text: All the following are functions of the superior oblique muscle except? (INICET MAY 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Adduction

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The superior oblique muscle is responsible for abduction, depression, and intorsion of the eye, but not adduction.

questions.text: Fibers from the structure marked in blue, terminate at which of the following? ( INICET May 2021)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C. Red nucleus

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The red nucleus is located in the midbrain and plays a role in motor coordination. Fibers from the cerebellum via the superior cerebellar peduncle decussate and terminate primarily in the contralateral red nucleus. From the red nucleus, some of these fibers continue on to the thalamus. Thus, the red nucleus is a major target of the superior cerebellar peduncle fibers.

questions.text: Which injury is not a part of ‘terrible triad of elbow’? (FMGE JAN 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Fracture of olecranon

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Fracture of olecranon is not a part of the terrible triad injury of the elbow. In the terrible triad injury, the radial head and coronoid process are fractured, along with dislocation of the elbow joint.
  • ➤ Fracture of olecranon is not a part of the terrible triad injury of the elbow.
  • ➤ In the terrible triad injury, the radial head and coronoid process are fractured, along with dislocation of the elbow joint.

questions.text: Which of the following is true for non-parametric tests? (NEET PG 2018)

options.label: A
options.text: ANOVA is an example of a non-parametric test

options.label: B
options.text: It is used for skewed distributions

options.label: C
options.text: It involves the assumption that the data has a normal distribution

options.label: D
options.text: It cannot be used for small sample sizes

questions.correct_answer: B. It is used for skewed distributions
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) It is used for skewed distributions

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Non-parametric tests are valuable statistical tools when dealing with skewed distributions or when the assumptions of parametric tests (like normal distribution) are not met. They provide robustness against the distribution shape of the data and are effective in handling smaller sample sizes and outliers.

questions.text: Which of the following culture media is used to differentiate other E. coli species from E. coli O157: H7? ( NEET PG 2020)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Sorbitol MacConkey agar

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Sorbitol MacConkey agar is critical for distinguishing E. coli O157 from other E. coli strains due to its unique inability to ferment sorbitol, helping guide appropriate public health responses and treatment options during outbreaks of foodborne illness.
